IN.title: India — Erasmus at a glance
bullets: Language of study: English widely used
Classroom vibe: Sir/Ma’am; attendance often counts
Budget: meals €2–3; daily €6–7 (food + local travel)
Everyday: bottled/filtered water; metro/rickshaw for short hops
Drill-down: click Kolkata pin for IIM Calcutta

cities.name: Kolkata

institutions.name: IIM Calcutta

cultural.language_and_vibe: English instruction; Bengali culture prevalent in the city. Formal academic atmosphere with strong case-based learning methodology.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Active student clubs in consulting, finance, and cultural activities; strong alumni network and peer mentorship programs.
cultural.hostel_culture: Residential campus with shared rooms; strong peer networks formed through mess dining and evening discussions.

tips: Arrive early for orientation and buddy assignment.
Metro and bus connectivity is excellent for city exploration.
Relative grading system - participation in class discussions is crucial.
Explore local Bengali cuisine and cultural heritage sites.

cardBullets: Campus: residential; strong peer networks; case-based learning
Courses/credits: management focus (confirm ECTS with FEB)
Assessment: relative grading; participation matters
Student life: hostels, mess dining, fests; metro/bus access
First steps: arrive early; orientation + buddy

cities.name: Bangalore

institutions.name: IIM Bangalore

cultural.language_and_vibe: English instruction; Kannada/Hindi widely heard in the city. MBA cohort with strong club culture and case-based learning.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Student clubs across consulting, entrepreneurship, music, sports; Exchange Committee runs welcome & cultural mixers.
cultural.hostel_culture: Single rooms on campus (subject to term availability); lively peer network and weekend city trips.

tips: Bengaluru weather is mild—carry a light jacket for evenings.
Autos and app cabs are easy; metro connects key areas.
Cafés and music venues around Koramangala/Indiranagar are student-friendly.

institutions.name: IIIT Bangalore

cultural.language_and_vibe: English on campus; collaborative tech culture with hackathons and meetups; Bengaluru is India’s ‘Silicon Valley’.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Coding, research and maker communities; access to city-wide tech meetups and conferences.
cultural.hostel_culture: Modern hostels; compact campus; strong peer networks for projects and startups.

tips: Tap into city tech meetups (e.g., Python, data, product design).
Weather is pleasant; sudden showers are common.
Try filter coffee & local Udupi eateries around Electronic City.

cardBullets: Campus: Modern, tech-driven; lush green spaces; cosmopolitan vibe.
Courses/credits: Strong in engineering, IT, and management.
Student life: Cafés, music, and startup culture; pleasant weather year-round.
First steps: Use metro/buses for easy city travel; try local cuisine like dosa and filter coffee.

cities.name: Delhi

institutions.name: IIT Delhi

cultural.language_and_vibe: English instruction; Hindi widely spoken in Delhi. Rigorous academic environment with strong emphasis on research and innovation. Campus has a rich history dating back to 1961.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Over 100+ student clubs covering technical, cultural, literary, and sports activities. Strong entrepreneurship ecosystem with incubation centers. Active research groups and international collaborations.
cultural.hostel_culture: Traditional hostel system with 13 hostels for boys and 2 for girls. Strong inter-hostel competitions, cultural nights, and lifelong friendships. Each hostel has its own mess and cultural identity.

tips: Delhi Metro is the best way to travel - campus is on the Pink Line (IIT Delhi station).
Winter months (Dec-Feb) can be quite cold and foggy - bring warm clothes.
Campus has excellent infrastructure including library, sports complex, and medical center.
Explore Delhi's rich history - Red Fort, India Gate, and Humayun's Tomb are nearby.
Try street food at Karol Bagh and Connaught Place, but start gradually to adjust to local cuisine.
Register for student ID card early for campus facility access.
Participate in literary societies and technical clubs for networking.
Weekend trips to Agra (Taj Mahal) and nearby hill stations are popular among students.

cardBullets: Campus: Historic 325-acre campus with modern facilities; IIT Delhi Metro station on campus.
Courses/credits: Engineering, technology, and interdisciplinary programs; semester system with grades.
Student life: 100+ clubs, annual fests (Rendezvous, Tryst), strong research culture.
Assessment: Continuous evaluation with quizzes, assignments, mid-sem and end-sem exams.
Accommodation: Traditional hostel system with mess facilities and cultural activities.
First steps: Get student ID, register for clubs, explore Delhi's rich cultural heritage.

cities.name: Mumbai

institutions.name: IIT Bombay

cultural.language_and_vibe: English instruction; Hindi and Marathi widely spoken. Research-driven and cosmopolitan environment with strong innovation and entrepreneurship culture.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Over 100 clubs in technology, culture, and entrepreneurship. Active student government and strong startup ecosystem.
cultural.hostel_culture: Hostel system with strong traditions and inter-hostel competitions. Vibrant student life and community engagement.

tips: Mumbai’s climate is humid—light clothing recommended year-round.
Local trains and metro are the fastest ways to travel across the city.
Participate in Mood Indigo and Techfest to experience IITB’s culture.
Campus is near Powai Lake—ideal for walks and relaxation.

cardBullets: Campus: 550-acre green campus beside Powai Lake; one of India’s top tech institutes.
Courses/credits: Engineering, sciences, and interdisciplinary research programs.
Student life: Vibrant fests (Mood Indigo, Techfest), diverse student clubs.
First steps: Explore campus early and join student organizations.

BE.title: Belgium — Home baseline
bullets: Languages: Dutch/French/German (region matters)
Feedback: more direct, structured expectations
Everyday: safe tap water, reliable trains
Classroom: open debate; first-name basis comes earlier
Use as comparison baseline

cities.name: Brussels

institutions.name: KU Leuven Brussels Campus

cultural.language_and_vibe: Dutch/French/English instruction; multicultural environment with European institutions nearby. Academic yet internationally focused atmosphere.
cultural.clubs_and_life: International student associations, EU policy clubs, and cultural organizations reflecting Brussels' diverse population.
cultural.hostel_culture: Mix of student housing and private accommodation; active international student community with regular cultural exchanges.

tips: Explore the Grand-Place and don't forget to try the waffles and fries.
Take advantage of proximity to EU institutions for internship opportunities.
Public transport is excellent - get a STIB/MIVB pass.
Brussels is trilingual - learn basic French/Dutch phrases.

institutions.name: Université Libre de Bruxelles (ULB)

cultural.language_and_vibe: French instruction with some English programs; liberal and research-focused academic culture with strong international perspective.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Active student life with numerous cultural, academic and political organizations; strong debate culture and social engagement.
cultural.hostel_culture: Urban campus integrated with city life; students often live in shared apartments throughout Brussels.

tips: Join student organizations early to build networks.
Take advantage of the vibrant nightlife and cultural events.
Explore different neighborhoods - each has its own character.
Use the extensive public library system for studying.

cardBullets: Campus: Home to multiple universities like KU Leuven Brussels Campus and ULB.
Courses/credits: Strong focus on international relations, politics, and business.
Student life: A multicultural hub with a vibrant nightlife and countless events.
First steps: Explore the Grand-Place, and don't forget to try the waffles and fries.

CN.title: China — Erasmus snapshot
bullets: Language of study: Mandarin is official, but many universities offer courses in English.
Classroom vibe: Generally formal, with high respect for professors.
Budget: Very affordable. A meal can be as cheap as €2–€4.
Everyday: Mobile payments (WeChat Pay/Alipay) are ubiquitous. Public transport is modern and efficient.
Drill-down: Explore major cities like Beijing and Shanghai.

cities.name: Beijing

institutions.name: Peking University

cultural.language_and_vibe: Mandarin and English instruction; prestigious academic environment with rich historical traditions. Formal respect for professors and academic hierarchy.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Vibrant international student community with cultural clubs, academic societies, and sports teams. Strong emphasis on academic excellence.
cultural.hostel_culture: Traditional campus dormitories with shared facilities; tight-knit international student community with regular cultural exchange activities.

tips: Get a VPN before arriving to access international websites.
Learn basic Mandarin phrases for daily interactions.
Explore the historic campus known as 'Yan Yuan' (the garden of Yan).
Use WeChat Pay and Alipay for most transactions.

cardBullets: Campus: Historic campus known as 'Yan Yuan' (the garden of Yan).
Courses/credits: Wide range of subjects, strong in humanities and sciences.
Student life: Vibrant international student community.
First steps: Get a VPN before arriving to access international websites.

cities.name: Shanghai

institutions.name: Fudan University

cultural.language_and_vibe: Mandarin and English instruction; cosmopolitan atmosphere reflecting Shanghai's international character. Business-focused and entrepreneurial mindset.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Modern student life with mix of traditional and contemporary culture; strong business and entrepreneurship clubs; access to Shanghai's vibrant city life.
cultural.hostel_culture: Modern dormitories in a bustling metropolis setting; diverse international community with regular networking events and cultural activities.

tips: Learn some basic Mandarin phrases to help with daily life.
Explore the mix of modern and traditional culture throughout the city.
Take advantage of Shanghai's extensive metro system.
Network with local business professionals and startups.

cardBullets: Campus: Located in a bustling metropolis, offering a dynamic city experience.
Courses/credits: Strong in business, medicine, and international relations.
Student life: Explore the mix of modern and traditional culture.
First steps: Learn some basic Mandarin phrases to help with daily life.

CA.title: Canada — Erasmus snapshot
bullets: Language of study: English and French (primarily in Quebec).
Classroom vibe: Collaborative and interactive, encourages student participation.
Budget: Higher than in Europe. Expect daily costs of €20–€30.
Everyday: Very multicultural. Tipping is customary (15-20%).
Drill-down: Check out universities in Toronto and Vancouver.

cities.name: Toronto

institutions.name: University of Toronto

cultural.language_and_vibe: English instruction; highly multicultural and research-intensive environment. Collaborative and diverse academic culture with global perspective.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Extensive student organizations, cultural clubs representing many nationalities, strong arts and food scene access in downtown Toronto.
cultural.hostel_culture: Mix of on-campus residences and off-campus housing; diverse student body creates rich cultural exchange opportunities.

tips: Get a PRESTO card for public transit.
Explore Toronto's diverse neighborhoods and food scene.
Take advantage of the vast array of courses available.
Prepare for cold winters - invest in proper winter clothing.

cardBullets: Campus: Downtown campus integrated with the city.
Courses/credits: Top-ranked university with a vast array of courses.
Student life: Diverse city with a great food and arts scene.
First steps: Get a PRESTO card for public transit.

cities.name: Vancouver

institutions.name: University of British Columbia

cultural.language_and_vibe: English instruction; outdoor-focused and environmentally conscious culture. Research-intensive with strong emphasis on sustainability and innovation.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Outdoor recreation clubs, environmental groups, and cultural organizations; strong connection to nature with easy access to mountains and ocean.
cultural.hostel_culture: Beautiful campus with ocean and mountain views; active outdoor lifestyle with hiking, skiing, and water sports communities.

tips: Pack for rainy weather, but enjoy the beautiful nature.
Take advantage of outdoor activities - hiking, skiing, kayaking.
Explore Vancouver's diverse neighborhoods and food scene.
Get a Compass Card for public transit in Vancouver.

cardBullets: Campus: Stunning campus with ocean and mountain views.
Courses/credits: Known for research and sustainability programs.
Student life: Outdoor activities are a huge part of the culture.
First steps: Pack for rainy weather, but enjoy the beautiful nature.

AU.title: Australia — Erasmus snapshot
bullets: Language of study: English.
Classroom vibe: Relaxed and informal. First names are common for lecturers.
Budget: Can be expensive. A simple lunch might be €10–€15.
Everyday: Laid-back lifestyle, strong coffee culture.
Drill-down: Explore the vibrant cities of Sydney and Melbourne.

cities.name: Sydney

institutions.name: University of Sydney

cultural.language_and_vibe: English instruction; relaxed and informal atmosphere with laid-back Australian lifestyle. Strong coffee culture and beach-oriented social life.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Extensive student societies, beach and surf clubs, cultural organizations; access to Sydney's vibrant nightlife, beaches, and cultural scene.
cultural.hostel_culture: Mix of on-campus accommodation and shared housing; outdoor lifestyle with easy access to beaches and harbor activities.

tips: Get an Opal card for easy travel on public transport.
Explore Sydney's famous beaches and harbor.
Take advantage of the neo-gothic sandstone campus architecture.
Be prepared for higher living costs, especially in the city center.

cardBullets: Campus: Famous for its neo-gothic sandstone buildings.
Courses/credits: Comprehensive university with a strong international reputation.
Student life: Beaches, nightlife, and a bustling city center.
First steps: Get an Opal card for easy travel on public transport.

cities.name: Melbourne

institutions.name: University of Melbourne

cultural.language_and_vibe: English instruction; arts-focused and culturally rich environment with strong emphasis on creativity and academic excellence. Coffee culture is central to social life.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Diverse student societies, arts and music clubs, cultural organizations; access to Melbourne's famous laneway culture, street art, and live music scene.
cultural.hostel_culture: Historic and modern campus near city center; active cultural scene with easy exploration of unique neighborhoods by tram.

tips: Explore the city's unique neighborhoods by tram.
Discover laneway cafes, street art, and live music venues.
Take advantage of Melbourne's reputation as Australia's cultural capital.
Get a Myki card for public transport throughout Melbourne.

cardBullets: Campus: A mix of historic and modern architecture, located near the city center.
Courses/credits: Particularly strong in arts, humanities, and medicine.
Student life: Known for its laneway cafes, street art, and live music scene.
First steps: Explore the city's unique neighborhoods by tram.

HR.title: Croatia — Erasmus snapshot
bullets: Language of study: Croatian, but English-taught programs are common.
Classroom vibe: Generally relaxed, but attendance can be important.
Budget: More affordable than Western Europe. Daily budget around €15–€20.
Everyday: Cafe culture is central. People enjoy long coffee breaks.
Drill-down: Discover the capital Zagreb and the coastal city of Split.

cities.name: Zagreb

institutions.name: University of Zagreb

cultural.language_and_vibe: Croatian with English-taught programs available; traditional European academic culture with growing international focus. Cafe culture is central to social interactions.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Active student organizations, cultural societies, and sports clubs; rich history and vibrant downtown with parks, museums, and markets.
cultural.hostel_culture: Spread throughout the city rather than a single campus; students gather in city center cafes and cultural venues for socializing.

tips: Enjoy the local markets and the vibrant downtown area.
Learn basic Croatian phrases for daily interactions.
Explore Zagreb's rich history through museums and architecture.
Take advantage of affordable living costs compared to Western Europe.

cardBullets: Campus: Spread throughout the city, not a single enclosed campus.
Courses/credits: The oldest and largest university in South-Eastern Europe.
Student life: A lively city with a rich history, museums, and parks.
First steps: Enjoy the local markets and the vibrant downtown area.

cities.name: Split

institutions.name: University of Split

cultural.language_and_vibe: Croatian with English programs available; coastal Mediterranean lifestyle with relaxed academic atmosphere. Strong connection to maritime heritage and island culture.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Water sports clubs, cultural organizations, and student societies; easy access to islands and beaches; strong connection to Roman history and architecture.
cultural.hostel_culture: Modern facilities with some offering stunning sea views; students enjoy outdoor lifestyle with sailing, swimming, and island hopping activities.

tips: Explore Diocletian's Palace and enjoy the Adriatic coastline.
Take advantage of ferry connections to nearby islands.
Learn about Roman history integrated into the modern city.
Enjoy the Mediterranean climate and outdoor lifestyle.

cardBullets: Campus: Modern facilities, with some faculties offering stunning sea views.
Courses/credits: Strong in marine sciences, engineering, and humanities.
Student life: Based in a historic Roman palace, with easy access to islands.
First steps: Explore Diocletian's Palace and enjoy the Adriatic coastline.

FR.title: France — Erasmus snapshot
bullets: Language of study: French is dominant, but many business schools offer English tracks.
Classroom vibe: Can be hierarchical, with an emphasis on theory and structured lectures.
Budget: Varies by city. Paris is expensive; other cities are more moderate.
Everyday: Bureaucracy can be challenging. A good meal is an important part of the day.
Drill-down: Experience life in Paris or the culinary capital, Lyon.

cities.name: Paris

institutions.name: Sorbonne University

cultural.language_and_vibe: French with some English programs; prestigious and traditional academic environment with emphasis on intellectual discourse. Hierarchical structure with formal professor-student relationships.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Rich cultural and academic societies; access to world-class museums, galleries, and cultural events; vibrant café culture and intellectual discussions.
cultural.hostel_culture: Historic campus in Latin Quarter; students often live in shared apartments throughout Paris; strong café study culture and intellectual networking.

tips: Get a Navigo pass for the metro and be prepared for a fast-paced life.
Learn French basics to fully engage with academic and social life.
Take advantage of numerous museums and cultural institutions.
Navigate French bureaucracy with patience and proper documentation.

cardBullets: Campus: Historic and prestigious, located in the heart of the Latin Quarter.
Courses/credits: World-renowned for arts, humanities, and sciences.
Student life: Endless museums, galleries, and cultural events.
First steps: Get a Navigo pass for the metro and be prepared for a fast-paced life.

cities.name: Lyon

institutions.name: University of Lyon

cultural.language_and_vibe: French instruction with growing English programs; gastronomic capital with strong focus on culinary arts and social sciences. More relaxed than Paris but maintaining academic rigor.
cultural.clubs_and_life: Culinary societies, cultural organizations, and student associations; access to Lyon's renowned restaurant scene and food markets; vibrant yet manageable city atmosphere.
cultural.hostel_culture: Multiple university campuses throughout the city; strong student community with food-centered social activities and cultural exchanges.

tips: Try the local 'bouchons' (traditional restaurants).
Explore Lyon's UNESCO World Heritage old town.
Take advantage of the excellent public transportation system.
Learn about French gastronomy - Lyon is considered France's food capital.

cardBullets: Campus: A major hub for higher education with several distinct universities.
Courses/credits: Strong in social sciences, technology, and gastronomy.
Student life: Considered France's food capital, with a vibrant and manageable city feel.
First steps: Try the local 'bouchons' (traditional restaurants).
